Define Documentation

#define CIMUNIT_FIRE (   eventName)
Value:
printf("CIMUNIT_FIRE(%s)\n", eventName); \
    cimunit_schedule_fire(g_cimunit_default_schedule, eventName)

Fire a CIMUnit event

This differs from cimunit_event_fire as it uses a global variable to simplify test development.

Definition at line 53 of file cimunit.h.

#define CIMUNIT_SCHEDULE (   schedule)
Value:
if (g_cimunit_default_schedule) { \
        cimunit_schedule_destroy(g_cimunit_default_schedule); \
    } \
    printf("CIMUNIT_SCHEDULE(%s)\n", schedule); \
    g_cimunit_default_schedule = cimunit_schedule_parse(schedule)

Create a CIMUnit schedule

This differs from cimunit_schedule_parse by using a global variable that works with the other CIMUnit macros to simplify test development in an environment where only one test will be run at a time.

Definition at line 41 of file cimunit.h.

#define CIMUNIT_THREAD_NAME (   threadName)
Value:
cimunit_schedule_set_thread_name(g_cimunit_default_schedule, \
                                     cimunit_thread_self(), \
                                     threadName)

Name a thread in the schedule

This macro gives a name to the currently executing thread
